questions.text: A 10-year-old boy presents to the eye clinic with complaints of redness, itching, and ropy discharge. He mentions that these symptoms worsen during the summer months. On examination, the doctor notices the presence of a pseudomembrane on the papillae on the upper tarsal conjunctiva. What is the term used to describe this characteristic appearance?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option D - Maxwell Lyon’s sig

Cobblestone appearance

  • It is characterized by papillary reaction with a cobblestone appearance.

Horner trantas spots

  • It develops horner trantas spots: white dots containing eosinophils.

 

Pseudogerontoxon/Cupid’s bow

  • When it involves the cornea, it forms the cupid's bow, also known as pseudogerontoxon.
  • Gerontoxon is another name for arcus senilis. The epithelial lesion in vernal conjunctivitis appears like arcus senilis. Hence the name pseudogerontoxon

 

Shield Cataract

  • Later stages lead to shield ulcer: deposition of mucus and calcium phosphates in micro-erosions

Maxwell Lyon's sign

  • Maxwell Lyon's sign is a pseudomembrane formed due to excessive deposition of mucus on the papilla.

questions.text: Mark the correct statement:

options.label: A
options.text: Danger abscess is a subtype of prevertebral abscess that ends at the level of T4 vertebrae

options.label: B
options.text: Prevertebral abscess appears on the side of the midline, and retropharyngeal abscess appears on the midline

options.label: C
options.text: Prevertebral space is a paired space, whereas retropharyngeal space is a single space

options.label: D
options.text: Prevertebral and retropharyngeal abscesses begin at the base of the skull.

questions.correct_answer: D. Prevertebral and retropharyngeal abscesses begin at the base of the skull.
questions.explanation:
Correct Option D - Prevertebral and retropharyngeal abscesses begin at th

Retropharyngeal Abscess

Prevertebral Abscess
  • Retropharyngeal space is a paired space. These abscesses can occur on the side of the midline due to that reason.
  • Prevertebral abscess will always be a single space.
  • A retropharyngeal abscess (RPA) can begin superiorly from the base of the skull. Inferiorly, if it is a true compartment abscess, it will end at the level of T4. If it is a danger space abscess, it will end at the level of the diaphragm.
  • Prevertebral abscess also begins at the base of the skull. Inferiorly, it extends to the coccyx.
  • Retropharyngeal abscess appears due to the suppuration of lymph nodes. Usually, it is an acute disease. Danger space abscess occurs due to the tuberculosis of the spine and is usually a chronic disease.
  • Prevertebral abscess is usually due to tuberculosis.
  • Retropharyngeal abscess appears and presents as a bulge on the side of the midline.
  • Prevertebral abscess presents as a midline bulge.

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy presents with cola-colored urine and pedal edema and gives a history of sore throat 2 weeks back which was not treated with antibiotics. Which of the following statements is true regarding the patient's condition? 1. It is a Type III Hypersensitivity reaction. 2. Streptococcus pyogenes: strains 12 and 4 are responsible. 3. Gross findings on the kidney shows a flea-bitten appearance. 4. Linear immunofluorescence is seen.
questions.explanation:
Correct Option A - 1, 2 and 3 are tru

Feature

Post-Streptococcal Glomerulonephritis

Alternative Names

Post Infectious Glomerulonephritis / Acute Proliferative Glomerulonephritis

Causative Agent

Streptococcus Pyogenes (Group A β Hemolytic streptococcus): Strain 12, 4, 1

Incubation Period

1-4 weeks

Clinical Features

Initially, the patient develops sore throat or Skin infection due to Streptococcus leading to Type 3 Hypersensitivity reaction which in turn causes PSGN (Cola colored urine)

Blood Tests
  • Antibodies: Anti-DNAse B (preferred), Antistreptolysin O (ASO)
  • Transient Hypocomplementemia blood test (Transient decrease in C3)

Gross Finding

Flea-bitten appearance

Light Microscopy
  • Increase in endothelial cells.
  • Increase in mesangial cells.
  • Increase in neutrophils.
  • Increase in macrophages.
  • Hypercellular glomeruli noted

Immunofluorescence

Starry sky appearance

Treatment

Antibiotics (usually penicillin or other appropriate antibiotics to eliminate the streptococcal infection)

questions.text: A 58-year-old male presents with chronic cough, hemoptysis, and weight loss. A chest X-ray reveals a peripherally located mass in the right lung. A biopsy of the lesion showed an invasive malignant epithelial tumor with glandular differentiation. The immunohistochemistry sample tested positive for CK 7 and TTF1. questions.explanation:
Correct Option C - CDKN2A

Epidemiology
  • Most common type of lung cancer.
  • Often diagnosed in non-smokers.

Histological Features
  • Glandular or acinar structures.
  • May contain mucin-producing cells.

Molecular Characteristics
  • Commonly harbors mutations in EGFR, KRAS, ALK rearrangements, and ROS1 rearrangements.

Clinical Presentation
  • Often presents with nonspecific symptoms like cough, shortness of breath, and weight loss.

Imaging Findings
  • Seen on chest X-ray or CT scan.
  • Peripheral location is common

questions.text: A 55-year-old Male with a history of Type 2 Diabetes and hypertension has been Enrolled in the diabetes management program for the past 6 months. It includes collecting data on his glycemic control, medication adherence, and healthcare utilization in the 6 months preceding his enrollment in the program along with Ongoing data collection during the 6-month participation period, including glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c) levels, lifestyle changes, and the frequency of healthcare visits. Which of the following is the most appropriate term for this study?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option C - Ambispective Cohort Stu

Cohort Study Type

Definition

Example

Mixed Cohort Study (Ambispective)

A mixed cohort study, often referred to as an ambispective cohort study, combines elements of both prospective and retrospective designs. It involves collecting both historical and ongoing data within the same study.

Enrolling participants at present, collecting baseline information retrospectively, and then following them prospectively for future outcomes.

Advantages

Allows for a comprehensive assessment of exposures and outcomes. - Can provide a quicker assessment of outcomes compared to a purely prospective study.

 

Disadvantages

May still be resource-intensive. - Combining retrospective and prospective data requires careful design and analysis.

questions.text: Which of the following methods of tubectomy is shown in the image given below?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option D - Parkland Techniqu

Technique

Description

Advantages and Disadvantages

Pomeroy Technique

Single ligature is used, and ends are cut. The tube cut ends are brought together, which can lead to fistula formation and failure.

Most commonly done. - Risk of fistula formation leading to failure.

Parkland Technique

Double ligature is used, and tubes are ligated separately.

Reduces the risk of fistula formation.

Madlener's Method

Tubes are crushed, not resected.

High failure rates; not commonly performed today.

Subserosal Dissection of Tube (Uchida procedure)

Serosa is lifted by needle & saline is injected, then serosa is incised, and tube is resected

The advantage is that fibrosis & adhesions are very less, as cut ends are within the serosa

questions.text: A 38-year-old woman presents with a several-month history of intermittent headaches and episodes of confusion. Neurological examination reveals focal seizures and imaging studies show a well-circumscribed, contrast-enhancing mass in the frontal lobe. The tumor exhibits a "fried egg" appearance with clear cytoplasmic halos on histopathology. What is the expected chromosomal defect in this case?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option C - Co-deletion 1p/19q

Definition
  • A type of primary brain tumor that arises from oligodendrocytes, a type of glial cell.

Histological Features
  • Typically has a "fried egg" appearance with a clear cytoplasm and a central round nucleus.

Genetic Alterations
  • Commonly associated with 1p/19q co-deletion.
  • IDH1/IDH2 mutations are frequently observed.

Grading
  • Classified as a grade II tumor according to the World Health Organization (WHO) grading system.

Clinical Presentation
  • Seizures are a common presenting symptom.
  • Slow-growing with a relatively indolent course.

Imaging Findings
  • Often presents as a well-circumscribed lesion in imaging studies.

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman came with complaints of infertility. The medical history indicates a family history of intellectual disabilities in multiple generations. Genetic testing is performed, and the results show an expansion of the CGG trinucleotide repeat in the FMR1 gene. The geneticist recommends amplicon analysis. What is the primary purpose of amplicon analysis in this context?

options.text: To quantify the level of FMR1 mRNA expression

options.label: B

questions.correct_answer: D. To determine the triplet repeat length in the FMR1 gene
questions.explanation:
Correct Option D - To determine the triplet repeat length in the FMR1 g

Genetic Cause

FMR1 gene (Familial Mental Retardation Gene).

CGG Repeats
  • Normal: CGG repeat count is below 55.
  • Permutation: CGG repeat count is between 55-200, resulting in Fragile X Tremors and Ataxia.
  • Mutation: CGG repeat count is between 200-4000, leading to Fragile X Syndrome.

Sherman's Paradox / Anticipation

With each generation, the number of CGG repeats, and the severity of the disease tend to increase.

Gender Predominance

Fragile X Syndrome mainly occurs in males. Females are carriers of the gene.

Premature Ovarian Failure

Carrier females are prone to Premature Ovarian Failure, which occurs before the age of 40.

options.text: Grants-in-aid to select institutions for research and development

options.label: B
options.text: Health education , maternity and child welfare services

options.label: C
options.text: Assists in the procurement of equipment like X-ray units, Microscopes, and anti-TB drugs

options.label: D
options.text: Assists in Improving Health Care for Adolescent Girls Project Child Survival Project

questions.correct_answer: C. Assists in the procurement of equipment like X-ray units, Microscopes, and anti-TB drugs
questions.explanation: Correct Option C - Assists in the procurement of equipment like X-ray units, Microscopes, and anti-TB drug

questions.text: A 26-year-old primigravida experienced heavy bleeding following a vaginal delivery. The obstetrician initiated oxytocin 20 units as an IV infusion followed by ergometrine as an IV bolus .The uterus is still atonic. Which of the following should be given in the next step of management for this patient?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option B - IM carboprost:

Inj. Carboprost (PGF α)

 

Administration

Intramuscular (IM) only

Route

Never given intravenous (IV) – causes sudden hypertension

Alternative Route

Can be given intra-myometrial

Indication

Administered when no other drug is working

Drug

Dose

Route

10-20 units

I.V.

0.2 mg

questions.text: A 17-year-old male presents with persistent and gradually progressive pain and swelling in his left proximal tibia for the past few months. The pain is localized, intermittent, and exacerbated during weight-bearing activities . On examination, there is tenderness, warmth, and a palpable mass over the proximal tibia. FNAC shows the presence of hemosiderin . An x-ray is given below. Which of the following can be a differential diagnosis for this condition?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option A - Giant cell tu

Aneurysmal Bone Cyst

Giant Cell Tumor

  • Filled with blood fluid
  • FNAC shows hemosiderin
  • Multinucleated giant cells are visible
  • FNAC shows no hemosiderin
  • Multinucleated giant cells are visible

questions.text: A 55-year-old male patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus presents to the clinic for a routine follow-up appointment. His current treatment regimen includes metformin and glipizide. During the visit, he reports experiencing episodes of hypoglycemia and weight gain over the past few months.Which of the following statements accurately describes the mechanism of action of glipizide, and which adverse effects are most likely contributing to the patient's symptoms?

options.label: A
options.text: Glipizide increases insulin sensitivity by activating AMP-activated protein kinase (AMPK); hypoglycemia and weight gain

options.label: B
options.text: Glipizide stimulates insulin secretion from pancreatic beta cells by closing ATP-sensitive potassium channels; hypoglycemia and weight gain

options.label: C
options.text: Glipizide inhibits hepatic glucose production by activating glucokinase; hyperglycemia and weight loss

options.label: D
options.text: Glipizide inhibits intestinal glucose absorption by inhibiting alpha-glucosidase; gastrointestinal disturbances and weight loss

questions.correct_answer: B. Glipizide stimulates insulin secretion from pancreatic beta cells by closing ATP-sensitive potassium channels; hypoglycemia and weight gain
questions.explanation: Correct Option B

questions.text: An intern in the emergency room accidentally gets pricked by a needle while performing cannulation on a patient. The patient's viral markers are as follows: Anti-HCV,HBsAg,IgM anti-HBc: Positive Anti-HBs ,HBeAg : Negative Which of the following is most appropriate regarding the status of the patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Acute hepatitis C and Acute hepatitis B

options.label: B
options.text: Acute hepatitis C and highly infectious hepatitis B

options.label: C
options.text: Chronic hepatitis C and hepatitis B during the window period

options.label: D
options.text: Chronic hepatitis C and hepatitis B vaccination

questions.correct_answer: A. Acute hepatitis C and Acute hepatitis B

questions.text: DiGeorge syndrome is due to a developmental anomaly of which of the following structures?

questions.text: In a 23-year-old male presenting to the emergency department with intractable vomiting and breathlessness, laboratory investigations revealed a bedside RBS of 426 mg/dl and metabolic acidosis on ABG analysis. Upon examining the urine sample, which of the following findings may be noted?

options.label: B
options.text: Positive Benedict’s and Positive Rothera’s test

options.label: C
options.text: Positive Benedict’s and negative Rothera’s test

options.label: D
options.text: Negative Benedict’s and Positive Rothera’s test

questions.correct_answer: B. Positive Benedict’s and Positive Rothera’s test
questions.explanation: Correct Option B - Positive Benedict’s and Positive Rothera’
